intro: Lagenophora linearis, commonly known as the slender lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and are arranged in clusters. Lagenophora linearis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
